title: Patriots advance to Super Bowl LX with AFC Championship win
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots New England defeated Denver to win the AFC Championship, and will play in Super Bowl LX on Feb.
A Patriots fan in Denver during the AFC Championship.

title: Review & setlist: Sutton Foster and her thoroughly modern cohorts warm up the Colonial
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Concert Reviews The Tony-winner took full advantage of support from Emerson Musical Theatre students and the South Shore Dance Ensemble.
Sutton Foster, here at Tanglewood last summer, brought her talents to Boston's Emerson Colonial Saturday night.

title: 2 killed, 2 injured in shooting at child’s party in Carver, suspect charged with murder
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime After a preliminary investigation, law enforcement officials say that the shooting does not appear to be a random act.
The shooting took place on at Saint John the Baptist Club on Silva Street in Carver, seen here.

Claire Thornton/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo January 25, 2026 | 10:50 AM 1 minute to read Two men were killed and two more were injured Saturday night in a shooting at a Carver social club, according to law enforcement officials.

title: Renovations to Back Bay station are now underway: Here’s what to know
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Transportation The construction project’s first phase will tackle the east side of the station and is expected to last until late June.
The first construction phase of the Back Bay station renovations will begin this month.

Lane Turner/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo January 25, 2026 | 10:12 AM 1 minute to read The first phase of the MBTA’s Back Bay Station Renovation Project will begin this month, marking the beginning of a complete revamp for the station’s interior.

title: Massive winter storm across the U.S. brings frigid temperatures and widespread power outages
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Weather The storm was expected to continue through Monday in a large part of the country, followed by very low temperatures, causing ice and “dangerous travel and infrastructure impacts” to linger for several days, the National Weather Service said.
Two people walk along the National Mall as snow falls, Sunday, Jan.
25, 2026, in Washington.

title: Federal judge in Boston warns Trump against targeting immigration status of students suing him
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The order aims to protect a group of noncitizen students from retaliation for suing the Trump administration.

A federal judge in Boston has ordered the Trump administration to stop arresting or deporting international students and academic faculty involved in a First Amendment lawsuit against the federal government.
U.

title: Celtics fall in final seconds against Bulls despite gritty Jaylen Brown game: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics The Celtics have a much-needed day off before a much-needed stretch of home games, which begin on Monday against the Trail Blazers.
Jaylen Brown gave the Celtics 33 points, 8 rebounds, and 5 assists in 37 minutes.
